definitions.definition: the middle point or part of something
definitions.sensetop: the center of somethingin the center of somethingat the center of something

examples.text: He walked to the center of the circle.
There was a long table in the center of the room.
The statue is in **the very center** of the temple.
Aristotle believed that the Earth was at the center of the universe.

definitions.definition: the main part of a town or city where there are a lot of shops and offices

examples.text: We both work in the **city center**.

definitions.definition: a place or an area where a lot of people live; a place where a lot of business or cultural activity takes place

examples.text: At that time Winchester was still a major center of population.
The university is a leading center for scientific research.
Small towns in South India serve as economic and cultural centers for the surrounding villages.

definitions.definition: a building or place used for a particular purpose or activity

examples.text: The company has recently opened a new **training center**.

definitions.definition: a place where a particular kind of work is done extremely well

examples.text: The university is recognized as an international center of excellence for training dentists.

definitions.definition: the point towards which people direct their attention

examples.text: She likes to be the **center of attention**.

definitions.definition: a moderate (= middle) political position or party, between the extremes of left-wing and right-wing parties
a player or position in the middle of the pitch, court, etc.
in or into the most important position

examples.text: The issue has moved front and center in his presidential campaign.
He's giving away money left, right and center.
